benchmark_details.name: LongGenBench (Long-context Generation Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: LongGenBench is a synthetic benchmark designed to evaluate the long-context generation capabilities of large language models (LLMs), focusing on consistency in logical flow across lengthy passages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive assessment of the long-context generation capabilities of large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The experiments were conducted on a limited set of models and datasets.

data.source: Synthesized from existing popular LLM benchmarks: MMLU, GSM8K, CommonSenseQA.

methodology.calculation: Measured by comparing generated long-context responses with ground truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Lower accuracy percentages indicate greater performance degradation in long-context scenarios.
methodology.validation: Experiment results averaged from three runs for robustness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All datasets used are released under MIT license.
